other_note.title: Advising on P2P Agreements
note: This is a firm that is given permission to provide regulated products and services

This firm also has permission to advise on P2P agreements. Permission to carry on this regulated activity is subject to the same requirements and limitations as apply to the firm's permission to advise on investments.

TypeRegulated Companies House Number This is a unique number given to a UK company or limited liability partnership 2738598 Current status Authorised  A firm that is given permission to provide regulated products and services. Effective Date This is the date from which the Current Status has applied. 01/12/2001 Tied Agent A tied agent can act on behalf of another firm or individual (its principal) that is regulated in another country in the European Economic Area (EEA). This firm is not a tied agent. Money Laundering Certain firms must protect themselves against money laundering and comply with the Money Laundering Regulations of 2007 This firm is not registered under the Money Laundering Regulations. Insurance Mediation A firm that offers or sells insurance products and services This firm is able to undertake insurance mediation.

This includes supervisory, disciplinary and civil regulatory action (but not criminal action) the FCA and/or PRA has taken, has decided or proposed to take and considers appropriate to publish.It also includes civil penalties the FCA has imposed or decided to impose. It does not include action taken by other enforcement agencies . Date Type of Action Enforcement Type 02/10/2008 Fines The FSA imposed a financial penalty of £28,000 on TBO for failure to establish and maintain effective systems and controls to: clearly document the explanation of the risks of transactions to clients; make and retain records that demonstrate the suitability of its advice; and ensure that its business is conducted in accordance with FSA requirements. TBO have agreed to undertake a risk-based past business review of customer files and to take remedial action where necessary. TBO breached Principle 3 (Management and Control) as the Firm: (i) inadequately supervised and monitor staff providing advice to customers; (ii) failed to record both the information provided by customers and the reasons for recommending products; (iii) had inadequate systems and controls in place in relation to trust signatures; and (iv) acting outside of its regulatory permission in one instance. TBO breached Principle 9 (Customers: relationships of trust) by failing to obtain and retain sufficient information about customers personal and financial circumstances and investment objectives. Furthermore, the suitability letters issued by TBO did not contain appropriate explanations of the risks associated with the transaction. FSMA

full_panel.header: Appointed representatives / tied agents / PSD or EMD agents
full_panel.body: An appointed representative is a firm or individual that can act on behalf of another firm or individual (its 'principal') that is authorised by the PRA and/or FCA. A tied agent can act on behalf of another firm or individual (its 'principal') that is regulated in another country in the European Economic Area (EEA). Appointed representatives and tied agents promote or deal in the products of their principal rather than all products in the market.A PSD or EMD agent is a firm that can act on behalf of another firm (its 'principal') that is authorised or registered by the FCA as a payment or e-money institution.The principal is responsible for the activities of its agents. Previously attached to: ‘Agent status’ shows whether an agent currently has an active relationship with any principal firm. Name  Insurance Mediation  Tied Agent  Firm reference number Effective From Effective To Agent status
